p: Because limited clinical research had been conducted in Sierra Leone prior to the Ebola epidemic, there were very few individuals in the country with appropriate research experience, and those that had this were generally involved in other Ebola-related studies. Technical and scientific support was therefore provided to the in-country team, facilitated by the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicineâ€™s response to the epidemic that allowed staff to temporarily leave their current post to work on the Ebola response.
